description: {"blocks":[{"key":"ddmqa","text":"Spatial proteomics holds great potential to transform our understanding of the role of cell populations and their spatial organizations in human tissues related to diseases. However, in-depth proteome measurement with high spatial resolution has been challenged by the low sample input and inefficient proteomics workflow. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bt2k","text":"In this protocol, we outlined the detailed procedure for high-resolution analysis of human pancreas tissue sections using a spatial proteomic platform by combining laser capture microdissection (LCM), nanoPOTS (nanodroplet processing in one pot for trace samples), and nanoflow liquid chromatography mass spectrometry (LC-MS). This protocol has been applied to human pancreas specimens for HubMAP Tissue Mapping Centers. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cerrj","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dgst6","text":"Expected outcome:","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a2elt","text":"The unbiased spatial proteome mapping of \u003e3000 proteins at 50-µm spatial resolution depending on sample types and LC-MS instrumentation.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

fork_info.title: LCM-NanoPOTS workflow for spatial proteome mapping

groups.title: Human BioMolecular Atlas Program (HuBMAP) Method Development Community

materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"i34i","text":"1.\tReagents","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6o0v0","text":"1.1.\tLCM collection","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5tidc","text":"•\tDimethyl sulfoxide (DMSO)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c2jch","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"l6cj","text":"1.2.\tProteomic sample processing","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3hohp","text":"•\tNanopure water","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1vmrk","text":"•\tn-Dodecy-ß-D-maltoside (DDM) (e.g. Thermo Fisher Scientific Cat# 89902)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"pdf0","text":"•\tHEPES (pH 8.5)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2f9bm","text":"•\tTCEP (tris(2-carboxyethyl)phosphine)-HCL (Thermo Fisher scientific, Cat# A35349)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"adfqn","text":"•\tChloroacetamide (CAA) (Thermo Fisher Scientific, Cat# A39270)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6n1k1","text":"•\tLys-C, (Promega, cat. no. V1671) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aocu6","text":"•\tTrypsin, (Promega, cat. no. V5280)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4kalj","text":"•\tFormic acid","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"en6c0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aolhq","text":"2.\tEquipment","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"10o5i","text":"•\tLaser Capture Microdissection System (Zeiss PALM MicroBeam)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f4d4o","text":"•\tHome-built nanoPOTS sample preparation system","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eos94","text":"•\tHome-built nanoPOTS LC autosampler system","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2a4e0","text":"•\tLC-MS/MS system (Orbitrap Eclipse Tribrid MS, Thermo Scientific)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b0s60","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7e0j7","text":"3.\tBuffer preparation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"brqr3","text":"3.1.\tExtraction buffer (Desired conc.: 1 mM TCEP, 0.1% DDM, 0.1 M HEPES)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"50l6p","text":"•\t10 µL, 1% DDM (Aliquoted 1% DDM is stored in -20 °C)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b3uno","text":"•\t88 µL, 0.1 M HEPES (pH 8.5)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"druha","text":"        o\tPrepare 0.1 M HEPES using premade 0.1 HEPES.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3a1k0","text":"        o\tCheck pH before use 0.1 M HEPES","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5lodv","text":"•\t2 µL, 50 mM TCEP","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7b5nm","text":"        o\tNo-Weigh, single-use TCEP, 1 mg (stored in 4 °C)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1gor2","text":"        o\tDissolve TCEP with 70 µL of 0.1 M HEPES","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ffn5","text":"        o\tVortex several times ~5 min to make sure it is completely dissolved","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2mdrj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bj43e","text":"3.2.\tAlkylation buffer (Desired conc.: 10 mM CAA in 0.1 M HEPES)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5h2o3","text":"•\tNo-Weigh, single-use CAA, 2 mg (stored in 4 °C)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4nncd","text":"•\tDissolve CAA with 214 µL 0.1 M HEPES to obtain 0.1 M CAA","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8m2ff","text":"•\tDilute to 10 mM CAA with 0.1 M HEPES","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9evkc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"46atq","text":"3.3.\tDigestion buffer (Desired conc.: 0.01 ng/nL Lys-C and 0.04 ng/nL Trypsin)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cbf5o","text":"•\t10 µL, 0.1 ng/nL Lys-C (Aliquoted in -80 °C)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9gvss","text":"•\t10 µL, 0.4 ng/nL Trypsin (Aliquoted in -80 °C)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2hmlm","text":"•\t80 µL, 0.1 M HEPES","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"75tnv","text":"Before cut and collection: Load DMSO as capturing media on the nanoPOTS chip","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"et5he","text":"Set the nanoPOTS robot to be ready (Temperature, humidity).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fgrne","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8bkam","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ap3tj","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"pul8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"fjpd4","text":"Align the nanoPOTS chip.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2ve9e","text":"Set 100 µL of DMSO (Dimethyl sulfoxide) in the sample plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6gk4i","text":"Dispense 200 nL of DMSO into each well on the nanoPOTS chip","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4nke3","text":"Cover the chip with the glass slide and cover with aluminum foil.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ms0l","text":"Cut and tissue collection","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"al7uf","text":"Turn on the LCM (PALM MicroBeam).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5hqcg","text":"Scan the tissue slide.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"e7mpe","text":"Find the target region on scanned image","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"aijdt","text":"Navigate to the region of interest (ROI).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8nqh4","text":"Draw 4 × 9 grid lines (1 voxel size= 2500 µm2) on ROI.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":44,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2sbf9","text":"Load the laser setting (Speed 1, Cut energy 40, LPC Energy delta15).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cihpf","text":"Load the nanoPOTS chip on the collector (slide collector 48). Align A1 corner of slide collector and A2 well corner of the nanoPOTS chip.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"besg9","text":"Start the collection with CenterRoboLPC function.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"20c8b","text":"After collecting all voxels, check on the microscope if every DMSO droplet contains the tissue voxel.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1a8dd","text":"Remove the nanoPOTS chip carefully from thecollector and cover it with the glass slide.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8scfc","text":"After collection: Dry and scan","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9n4d9","text":"Set incubator temperature to 70 °C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"d1jio","text":"Wrap with foil and store it in -20 °C until analysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ab6uf","text":"After DMSO has evaporated, scan the nanoPOTS chip and check if there is any missing well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ujtk","text":"After 15 min, unwrap the chip and place uncovered in incubator for 5 min intervals until DMSO has evaporate (~19 min).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9dsr1","text":"Place chips upside down (still wrapped) into incubator for 15 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: NanoPOTS Proteomic Sample Processing for LCM tissue
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"aj8jf","text":"Extraction","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: NanoPOTS Proteomic Sample Processing for LCM tissue
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"e2ur5","text":"Alkylation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: NanoPOTS Proteomic Sample Processing for LCM tissue
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"f3r8k","text":"Acid Quenching","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: NanoPOTS Proteomic Sample Processing for LCM tissue
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"c0ea5","text":"Digestion","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: NanoPOTS Proteomic Sample Processing for LCM tissue
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"42jei","text":"Remove chips from incubator and place into nanoPOTS robot.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: NanoPOTS Proteomic Sample Processing for LCM tissue
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a2tpg","text":"Dispense 50 nL of 5% formic acid in water into each well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: NanoPOTS Proteomic Sample Processing for LCM tissue
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bieeh","text":"Set the nanoPOTS robot to be ready (Temperature, humidity).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: NanoPOTS Proteomic Sample Processing for LCM tissue
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fjo1i","text":"Cover with a sterile glass slide, wrap with foil and store at -20 °C until analysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: NanoPOTS Proteomic Sample Processing for LCM tissue
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4cj9m","text":"Place the chip upside down in the humidity box in a zipper bag at 70 °C for 60 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: NanoPOTS Proteomic Sample Processing for LCM tissue
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3to4","text":"Cover chip with the glass slide and cover with aluminum foil.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: NanoPOTS Proteomic Sample Processing for LCM tissue
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7hi7n","text":"Dispense 200 nL of the extraction buffer into each well on the nanoPOTS chip.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: NanoPOTS Proteomic Sample Processing for LCM tissue
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ejk45","text":"Place 100 µL of extraction buffer (1 mM TCEP (tris(2-carboxyethyl)phosphine), 0.1% DDM (n-Dodecy-ß-D-maltoside), 0.1 M HEPES (pH 8.5)) in the sample plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: NanoPOTS Proteomic Sample Processing for LCM tissue
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ebfhh","text":"Align the nanoPOTS chip.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: NanoPOTS Proteomic Sample Processing for LCM tissue
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a9h7q","text":"Set chip at RT and put it into nanoPOTS robot.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: NanoPOTS Proteomic Sample Processing for LCM tissue
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"da6e9","text":"Place the chip upside down in the dark for 30 min at RT.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: NanoPOTS Proteomic Sample Processing for LCM tissue
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fs9tn","text":"Cover chip with glass slide and wrap with foil.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: NanoPOTS Proteomic Sample Processing for LCM tissue
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"sb0l","text":"Dispense 50 nL of alkylation buffer (10 mM CAA (2-chloroacetamide) in 0.1 M HEPES) into each well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: NanoPOTS Proteomic Sample Processing for LCM tissue
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"f1e87","text":"Place 100 µL of alkylation buffer in the sample plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: NanoPOTS Proteomic Sample Processing for LCM tissue
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7gere","text":"Set chip into nanoPOTS robot.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: NanoPOTS Proteomic Sample Processing for LCM tissue
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fel86","text":"Place the chip upside down in the humidity box for 10 h at 37 °C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: NanoPOTS Proteomic Sample Processing for LCM tissue
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"aohte","text":"Cover chip with a glass slide and cover with foil.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: NanoPOTS Proteomic Sample Processing for LCM tissue
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"chjr7","text":"Dispense 50 nL of digestion buffer (0.01 ng/nL LysC, 0.04 ng/nL trypsin in 0.1 M HEPES) into each well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: NanoPOTS Proteomic Sample Processing for LCM tissue
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"497kv","text":"Place 100 µL of digestion buffer in the sample plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: NanoPOTS Proteomic Sample Processing for LCM tissue
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"50mlg","text":"Remove the chip from the nanoPOTS robot and place it into the desiccator until the droplets have evaporated.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6uc3l","text":"In-house assembled nanoPOTS autosampler with an in-house packed SPE column (100 μm i.d., 4 cm, 5 μm, 300 Å C18 material, Phenomenex) and an LC column (50 μm i.d., 25 cm, 1.7 μm, 190 Å C18 material, Waters) heated to 50 using AgileSleeve column heater (Analytical Sales and services, Inc., Flanders, NJ) was used for sample analysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7qn0","text":"Samples were dissolved with Buffer A (0.1% formic acid in water) on the chip, then trapped on the SPE column for 5 min. After washing the peptides, samples were eluted at 100 nL/min and separated using a 60-min gradient from 8% to 35% Buffer B (0.1% formic acid in acetonitrile).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ale73","text":"An Orbitrap Eclipse Tribrid mass spectrometer (Thermo scientific) with FAIMS-pro interface operated in data-dependent acquisition mode was used for all analyses. Peptides were ionized by applying a voltage of 2,400 V.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5b5e7","text":"The ionized peptides were fractionated by the FAIMSpro interface using a 3-CV (-45, -60, -75 V) method. Fractionated ions with a mass range 350-1600 m/z were scanned at 120,000 resolution with an IT of 118 ms and an AGC target of 1E6.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1clu","text":"For the pooled tissue samples for generating a spectral library, a single CV was used for each LC-MS run. Precursor ions with intensities \u003e 1E4 were selected for fragmentation by 30% HCD and scanned in an Ion trap with an AGC of 2E5 and an IT of 86 ms.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"u692","text":"Use FragPipe (v 17.1, MSFragger v3.4, Philosopher v 4.1.0) for processing (feature detection, database searching and protein/peptide quantification) of all raw files.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"b3l7f","text":"For database search, use the latest Uniprot human database.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2iocl","text":"Fixed modification: carbamidomethylation of cysteine / Variable modification: Protein N-terminal acetylation, oxidation of methionine.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5kuuc","text":"Cleavage enzyme: strict trypsin, peptide length: 7-50, max missed cleavage: 2, FDR 0.01","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cgva3","text":"For quantifications, use match between runs (MBR) and MaxLFQ embedded in the FragPipe (minimum ions:1; minimum scans: 3; m/z tolerance 10 ppm; RT tolerance 0.4 min; MBR FDR at ion level 0.05).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: LCM-NanoPOTS workflow for spatial proteome mapping
